metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The ng-repeat directive is perfect for displaying tables.
content.html: The ng-repeat directive is perfect for displaying tables.

content.text: Displaying tables with angular is very simple:
content.html: Displaying tables with angular is very simple:

content.code: {{ x.Name }}{{ x.Country }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="customersCtrl">

<table>
  <tr ng-repeat="x in names">
    <td>{{ x.Name }}</td>
    <td>{{ x.Country }}</td>
  </tr>
</table>

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('customersCtrl', function($scope, $http) {
  $http.get("customers.php")
  .then(function (response) {$scope.names = response.data.records;});
});
</script>

content.text: To make it nice, add some CSS to the page:
content.html: To make it nice, add some CSS to the page:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<style>table, th , td {  border: 1px solid grey;  
border-collapse: collapse;  padding: 5px;}table tr:nth-child(odd) {  
background-color: #f1f1f1;}table tr:nth-child(even) {  
background-color: #ffffff;}</style>

border: 1px solid grey;  
border-collapse: collapse;  padding: 5px;

content.code:
<style>table, th , td {  border: 1px solid grey;
border-collapse: collapse;  padding: 5px;}table tr:nth-child(odd) {
background-color: #f1f1f1;}table tr:nth-child(even) {
background-color: #ffffff;}</style>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<style>table, th , td {  border: 1px solid grey;  
border-collapse: collapse;  padding: 5px;}table tr:nth-child(odd) {  
background-color: #f1f1f1;}table tr:nth-child(even) {  
background-color: #ffffff;}</style>

border: 1px solid grey;  
border-collapse: collapse;  padding: 5px;

content.code_html:
<style>
table, th , td {
  border: 1px solid grey;
  border-collapse: collapse;
  padding: 5px;
}

table tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background-color: #f1f1f1;
}

table tr:nth-child(even) {
  background-color: #ffffff;
}
</style>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<style>table, th , td {  border: 1px solid grey;  
border-collapse: collapse;  padding: 5px;}table tr:nth-child(odd) {  
background-color: #f1f1f1;}table tr:nth-child(even) {  
background-color: #ffffff;}</style>

border: 1px solid grey;  
border-collapse: collapse;  padding: 5px;

content.text: To sort the table, add an orderBy filter:
content.html: To sort the table, add an orderBy filter:

content.code: {{ x.Name }}{{ x.Country }}
content.code_html:
<table>
  <tr ng-repeat="x in names | orderBy : 'Country'">
    <td>{{ x.Name }}</td>
    <td>{{ x.Country }}</td>
  </tr>
</table>

content.text: To display uppercase, add an uppercase filter:

content.code: {{ x.Name }}{{ x.Country | uppercase }}
content.code_html:
<table>
  <tr ng-repeat="x in names">
    <td>{{ x.Name }}</td>
    <td>{{ x.Country | uppercase }}</td>
  </tr>
</table>

content.text: To display the table index, add a <td> with $index :
content.html: To display the table index, add a <td> with $index:

content.code_html:
<table>
  <tr ng-repeat="x in names">
    <td>{{ $index + 1 }}</td>
    <td>{{ x.Name }}</td>
    <td>{{ x.Country }}</td>
  </tr>
</table>

content.code: {{ x.Name }}{{ x.Name }}{{ x.Country }}{{ x.Country }}
content.code_html:
<table>
  <tr ng-repeat="x in names">
    <td ng-if="$odd" style="background-color:#f1f1f1">{{ x.Name }}</td>
    <td ng-if="$even">{{ x.Name }}</td>
    <td ng-if="$odd" style="background-color:#f1f1f1">{{ x.Country }}</td>
    <td ng-if="$even">{{ x.Country }}</td>
  </tr>
</table>
